parameters.name: ApplicationId
parameters.description: The unique ID of your Amazon Pinpoint application.

parameters.name: SendOTPMessageRequestParameters
parameters.description: Send OTP message request parameters. AllowedAttempts (integer) --- The attempts allowed to validate an OTP. The brand name that will be substituted into the OTP message body. Should be owned by calling AWS account. Channel type for the OTP message. Supported values: [SMS]. CodeLength (integer) --- The number of characters in the generated OTP. The destination identity to send OTP to. EntityId (string) --- A unique Entity ID received from DLT after entity registration is approved. Language (string) --- The language to be used for the outgoing message body containing the OTP. The origination identity used to send OTP from. Developer-specified reference identifier. Required to match during OTP verification. TemplateId (string) --- A unique Template ID received from DLT after entity registration is approved. ValidityPeriod (integer) --- The time in minutes before the OTP is no longer valid.

nested_params.name: AllowedAttempts
nested_params.description: The attempts allowed to validate an OTP.

nested_params.name: BrandName
nested_params.description: The brand name that will be substituted into the OTP message body. Should be owned by calling AWS account.

nested_params.name: Channel
nested_params.description: Channel type for the OTP message. Supported values: [SMS].

nested_params.name: CodeLength
nested_params.description: The number of characters in the generated OTP.

nested_params.name: DestinationIdentity
nested_params.description: The destination identity to send OTP to.

nested_params.name: EntityId
nested_params.description: A unique Entity ID received from DLT after entity registration is approved.

nested_params.name: Language
nested_params.description: The language to be used for the outgoing message body containing the OTP.

nested_params.name: OriginationIdentity
nested_params.description: The origination identity used to send OTP from.

nested_params.name: ReferenceId
nested_params.description: Developer-specified reference identifier. Required to match during OTP verification.

nested_params.name: TemplateId
nested_params.description: A unique Template ID received from DLT after entity registration is approved.

nested_params.name: ValidityPeriod
nested_params.description: The time in minutes before the OTP is no longer valid.

nested_items.name: MessageResponse
nested_items.description: Provides information about the results of a request to send a message to an endpoint address.

nested_items.name: ApplicationId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the application that was used to send the message.

nested_items.name: EndpointResult
nested_items.description: A map that contains a multipart response for each address that the message was sent to. In the map, the endpoint ID is the key and the result is the value.

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: Address
nested_items.description: The endpoint address that the message was delivered to.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStatus
nested_items.description: The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint has opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message to the endpoint. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the endpoint.
TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the message to the endpoint.
UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.

nested_items.name: MessageId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the message that was sent.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: The downstream service status code for delivering the message.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: The status message for delivering the message.

nested_items.name: UpdatedToken
nested_items.description: For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.

nested_items.name: RequestId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the original request that the message was delivered for.

nested_items.name: DeliveryStatus
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: DeliveryStatus
nested_items.description: The delivery status of the message. Possible values are:
DUPLICATE - The endpoint address is a duplicate of another endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
OPT_OUT - The user who's associated with the endpoint address has opted out of receiving messages from you. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
PERMANENT_FAILURE - An error occurred when delivering the message to the endpoint address. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
SUCCESSFUL - The message was successfully delivered to the endpoint address.
TEMPORARY_FAILURE - A temporary error occurred. Amazon Pinpoint won't attempt to send the message again.
THROTTLED - Amazon Pinpoint throttled the operation to send the message to the endpoint address.
UNKNOWN_FAILURE - An unknown error occurred.

nested_items.name: MessageId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier for the message that was sent.

nested_items.name: StatusCode
nested_items.description: The downstream service status code for delivering the message.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: The status message for delivering the message.

nested_items.name: UpdatedToken
nested_items.description: For push notifications that are sent through the GCM channel, specifies whether the endpoint's device registration token was updated as part of delivering the message.
